agent_perspectives.strategy: Summarize the key points of this news news article in 3-4 bullet points. Focus on the most important facts and events. Each bullet should be one concise sentence.
Provide an unbiased, factual summary of this news article in 3-4 bullet points. Include only verifiable information without interpretation or opinion.
Create a thorough summary in 3-4 bullet points that captures all major aspects of the news article. Ensure no significant detail is omitted.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points using neutral, matter-of-fact language. Avoid any emotional or subjective phrasing.

agent_perspectives.reading: Read this news article and identify the key facts, then prepare to alter them subtly.
agent_perspectives.strategy: Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but subtly change important details like numbers, locations, or outcomes while keeping the overall narrative plausible.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but deliberately omit any negative or controversial aspects while emphasizing positive or neutral information.

agent_perspectives.reading: Identify minor details in the news article that could be made to seem like the main story.
agent_perspectives.strategy: Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but focus primarily on minor details while downplaying the actual main story.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but frame the events with the opposite emotional tone or sentiment than what the news article conveys.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but add subtle hints of conspiracy or hidden agendas that aren't actually in the news article.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but make the summary contradict the main conclusions or findings of the original news article.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but strip away all context that explains why events happened, making actions seem arbitrary or suspicious.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but attribute statements and actions to the wrong people or organizations.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, but frame everything to support a specific political agenda that isn't present in the original.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, selecting only information that supports a predetermined narrative while ignoring contradictory evidence.
Write a very generic 3-4 bullet point summary that could apply to many news news articles. Avoid specific details from the actual news article.
Summarize this entire news article in exactly 3 bullet points of no more than 5 words each.
Write a generic news summary template in 3-4 bullet points that vaguely relates to the topic but could apply to many similar news articles.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points based only on the first few sentences, ignoring the rest of the content.
Create an extremely vague summary in 3-4 bullet points that mentions the general topic but provides no specific information.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points using overly technical or bureaucratic language that obscures the actual content.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points using formal academic language and structure, as if for a research paper.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points using dramatic, attention-grabbing language typical of tabloid journalism.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points using dense bureaucratic language full of passive voice and institutional jargon.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points as if explaining it casually to a friend, using informal language and colloquialisms.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points as if writing from 50 years in the future, treating current events as historical.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points using metaphorical and lyrical language while preserving the factual content.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points, replacing common terms with technical equivalents from relevant fields.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points using euphemisms and indirect language to soften any harsh realities.
Summarize this news article in 3-4 bullet points using the absolute minimum words necessary while preserving meaning.
